channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What’s Inside a 10th Floor ICE Office? New York Democrats Want to Know.
item.description: Nine members of Congress are accusing the federal authorities of blocking their right to examine conditions at what is supposed to be a temporary stop...

item.title: Airlines Challenge Protections For Travelers With Wheelchairs
item.description: A landmark rule to expand the rights of disabled air travelers has been hamstrung by a lawsuit from major airlines and delayed enforcement by the Tran...

item.title: Appeals Court Lets Trump Keep Control of California National Guard in L.A.
item.description: A panel rejected a lower court’s finding that it was likely illegal for President Trump to use state troops to protect immigration agents from protest...

item.title: 25-year-old who delivered donuts to Silicon Valley bosses with his resume hidden inside is going viral as Gen Z is desperate for job-hunting hacks
item.description: With millions of Gen Zers unemployed and AI killing entry-level jobs, one creative resume hack from 2016 is going viral again.

item.title: Mamdani Helped a Rival Candidate. She Isn’t Returning the Favor.
item.description: Adrienne Adams, the City Council’s first Black speaker, has resisted pressure to cross-endorse Zohran Mamdani, renewing battle lines between some Blac...

item.title: Barbra Streisand on the Duets That Define Her: ‘I Like Drama’
item.description: With a new album due next week that pairs her with Paul McCartney, Bob Dylan, Laufey, Sam Smith and more, the singer looks back at her prized collabor...

item.title: Crypto VCs were once an exotic species—now they’re part of the tech ecosystem
item.description: While some obvious differences remain, crypto investing now feels like just another stream in venture.

item.title: Female founders are optimistic that AI could solve challenges they face funding and scaling startups
item.description: Fifty-six percent of female founders say they see more opportunity because of AI.

item.title: Greenhouse unveils a new tool that makes the job search feel more like a dating app
item.description: The HR company wants candidates to mark certain applications as the “Dream Jobs.”

item.title: How CFOs and CMOs can team up to drive long-term growth
item.description: Marketing has slid to the back seat at many companies, according to McKinsey research.

item.title: Live Updates: Iran Fires More Missiles Into Israel and Casts Doubt on Talks
item.description: Iranian missiles hit several points in Israel, causing injuries and damage in the northern city of Haifa. Iran’s foreign minister said there was “no r...

item.title: Ex-Malaysia Premier Najib Has Money Laundering Charges Dropped
item.description: Money-laundering charges against Najib Razak were dropped because of prosecutorial delays, intensifying criticism that he was being treated leniently.

item.title: Air India Plane Crash Highlights Dangers of Crowded Airport Zones
item.description: The crash of an Air India flight shows how the country’s ambitions of rapid growth are often superimposed on urban infrastructures already pushed to t...

item.title: Iran’s Foreign Minister Meets With European Counterparts Amid War Fears

item.title: Europe’s Growing Fear: How Trump Might Use U.S. Tech Dominance Against It
item.description: To comply with a Trump executive order, Microsoft recently suspended the email account of an International Criminal Court prosecutor in the Netherland...
